body.p: McPherson was born on November 14, 1828 in Sandusky County, Ohio. He graduated from West Point in 1849 and was commissioned to the Corps of Engineers.He taught practical engineering at West Point for a year before being stationed in California. With the beginning of the Civil War, McPherson was first assigned to help work on fortifications in Boston and then became Aide-de-camp to Major General H. W. Halleck in Missouri. He was later being assigned to General Ulysses S. Grant as chief engineer in the Tennessee campaign. He participated in the battles of Fort Henry and Fort Donelson as well as the battles of Shiloh and Corinth prior to being promoted to major general of volunteers. After the fall of Vicksburg in 1863, McPherson was promoted to Brigadier General. in March 1864, he was put in charge of the Army of the Tennessee under General William T. Sherman in his campaign to Atlanta. While in this role, McPherson was shot and killed by a Confederate guerrilla on July 22, 1864.
